thing-type.label: Heating Control Thermostat for controlling the opentherm protocol
thing-type.description: Thermostat for controlling the opentherm protocol<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe Heating Control is the central point of your climate environment. You can overwrite the temperature setpoint of your thermostat, and this product also reports information about your thermostat or boiler. For example the room temperature, boiler pressure, modulation level or water temperature.</p&gt <p&gtThis product can be simply placed between your thermostat and boiler. The current setup is not changed and therefore you can still use the device as you normally would do. You don’t have to replace your current thermostat.</p&gt <p&gtNote: This product only works if the current communication between your thermostat and boiler uses the standardized modulating protocol Open Therm. If you are not sure whether your thermostat/boiler uses Open Therm, you may find that in the manual of your thermostat/boiler. You can also find it on the internet. You can search for example on ‘Honeywell round clock open therm’.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPress and hold the push button for 2 seconds and release to start the inclusion or exclude process.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPress and hold the push button for 2 seconds and release to start the inclusion or exclude process.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Set to default
parameter.description: Set all configuration values to default values (factory settings)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf 0xFF (255) then set to default</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Data request interval
parameter.description: Interval of updating data from thermostat and boiler<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval in seconds that data is requested (and therefore updated) from the thermostat and boiler. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: T room update difference
parameter.description: Difference of temperature before new update<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe value that the room temperature must differ (compared to his previous send value) before an unsolicited room temperature report is send to the associated node. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: T setpoint update difference
parameter.description: Difference in setpoint before new update<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe value that the temperature setpoint must differ (compared to his previous send value) before an unsolicited temperature setpoint report is send to the associated node. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Unsolicited CRC
parameter.description: CRC-16 encapulation<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtConfigure if the unsolicited reports are send with the CRC-16 encapsulation. Not that the receiving node should support this encapsulation to parse the Z-Wave frame! </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1
parameter.label: 6: Type of 'special' thermostat
parameter.description: Type of 'special' thermostat if applicable<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtType of 'special' thermostat. NOTE: when remeha Celcia 20 support is set than any other thermostat cannot be set (!) NOTE2: when Remeha Celcia 20 gives 'Fout 203' send cfg value again </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: Status auto report
parameter.description: Status auto report boiler/thermostat report.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtStatus auto report boiler/thermostat report.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Enable/Disable thermostat schedule
parameter.description: Enable/Disable thermostat schedule inside the controller<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable/Disable thermostat schedule inside the heatingcontroller</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: Readout manual setpoint thermostat
parameter.description: Readout manual setpoint thermostat<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter is used to set the possible manual readout of the setpoint on the thermostat. If the thermostat is manually set to a different mode it is then possible to readout this value if enabled.</p&gt <p&gt(NB. This setting is not in the manual but verified through contacting the service department of BeNext).</p&gt</p&gt
